revised_title: Infra-Red Sensitivity of Copper-Activated Zinc Cadmium Sulphide Phosphors
tldr: The article describes experiments on the infra-red sensitivity of a copper-activated zinc cadmium sulphide phosphor. The phosphor's sensitivity to infra-red radiation was found to have peaks at wavelengths of 2.1 and 2.7/4. The study also discusses the mechanism of infra-red interaction with phosphors, involving electron traps and luminescent transitions.
